alert.note: Alert for Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 18 at 12:48PM MDT until April 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, greatest over the higher hills. Winds gusting 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, and southeast Montana. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be impacted by snow, areas of poor visibility and strong west to northwest winds. The interstate and major highways are expected to stay wet, except for the higher passes which may see slushy conditions by daybreak Wednesday. The cold, wet and windy weather will be hazardous for young livestock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as rain then change to snow overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1.
